CLUE: Of system of land-holding in Middle Ages
FOUND IN: Feudalism: The dominant socio-economic structure characterized by the exchange of land for military service or labor obligations between lords and vassals.

Seneschal: An official serving as the chief domestic and financial steward of a castle, managing estates, organizing feasts and entertainments, and acting as an intermediary between lords and their vassals.
